job_title: Visual Resources Librarian in San Diego, CA
pros: Good management, Organized space, Easy tasks
cons: Small space, entry level pay

review_title: Great environment but they need to treat employees better.
job_title: Lab Assistant in San Diego, CA
pros: Flexible Kind people Good place to get experience of a lot of basic skills.
cons: Lots of work and not enough resources.

job_title: Tutor in San Diego, CA
pros: It's wonderful to contribute to other's learning.
cons: Only part time for tutors, and no benefits obviously.

job_title: Small Business Advisor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Great Place to Work Good Work-Life Balance Helping People
cons: Far away from ost of San Diego

job_title: Faculty Member in San Diego, CA
pros: Great faculty and staff; the backbone of Southwestern College. The majority will do what it takes to support students-ranging from instruction to providing free food.
cons:
Similar to the administrative team, there are many faculty members and staff that don't try to develop their current skills and see room for improvement. 

Much of the administration is sub-par, mediocre at best. Some of them have questionable backgrounds and lack basic people skills. The administration has a reputation for not trusting or empowering faculty/employees. 

Unfortunately, mismanagement is embedded into the culture at Southwestern College.

review_title: After 20 years of loyalty, external applicants still take priority
job_title: Financial Accountant in Chula Vista, CA
pros: It is a convenient place to work while going to school.
cons: There are many open positions but they arent often advertised for internal applicants regardless of qualifications.

review_title: Grossly incompetent admins and overworked professors
job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Higher than average pay per hour
cons: Have to deal with incompetent admins that constantly put politics and their own gain over the students and the performance of the school.

job_title: Math Tutor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Great work-life balance and learning opportunities.
cons: Low opportunities to move up. Work only for students

review_title: Toxic, don’t work here unless you are desperate
job_title: Full Time Faculty in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Good Calstrs retirement, but that’s it.
cons: Politics, favoritism, Counselors are treated differently than all other faculty. Student services division is horrible. The worst place I ever worked. They lie to you to get you to take additional work. They cross persona boundaries. Just google the schools name and “lawsuit”. They run through administrators like crazy because the leave to if the don’t want to o the district unethical bidding.

job_title: Clerical Assistant II in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Very friendly coworkers. Like family
cons: You get paid every month

job_title: Lifeguards in San Diego, CA
pros: Nice people and clean place
cons: Low pay for job done

review_title: Nice place to work, but be aware of the constant trend-chasing
job_title: Writer in San Diego, CA
pros:
Some great supervisors
Flexibility
Working with good people
cons:
Some miserable supervisors
The administration
Ludicrous bureaucracy
Trend chasing

review_title: Use as a stepping stone not as a permanent stay
job_title: Student Services in Chula Vista, CA
pros: All holidays off and a steady schedule with an average public school. Great benefits and a strong union constituent employment groups.
cons: There is no room for advancement for more veteran employees (those who have worked in the same position for 5+ years). Indirect nepotism runs rampant and there is major lack of leadership in all areas.

review_title: Great Community within a Poor System
job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Southwestern is the best college I've worked at as far as coworkers and overall culture. My department chair advocates for adjuncts, and I can expect similar course offers every semester.
cons: Unfortunately, the education system is broken and the pay is terrible, just like every other college in California. I teach the max classes allowed to an adjunct, and don't even qualify for an on-campus office, benefits for my children, or a living wage.

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Great environment to work, new building and equipment to work and teach.
cons: Nothing negative to say about Southwestern College.

review_title: Good School, Not as Bad as You Think
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Diego, CA
pros: cheap and affordable for those who have income issues, but also a very reliable education
cons: Not many, but communication with financial aid counselors was sometimes difficult

job_title: Lab Technician in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Good compensation, benefits, free parking for employees.
cons: No promotions or flexible work arrangements

job_title: Preschool Teacher in San Diego, CA
pros: SWC is an amazing place to work, with great benefits and a employee union that works hard for the benefit of all employees.
cons: no disadvantages so far, looking for growth.

job_title: Disability Support Services Student Worker in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Great community and supportive environment
cons: Very small pay and hours available. However, it was part of a work-study program that only allowed for us to work for 20 hours a week with minimum wage

job_title: Human Resources Administrator in Texas City, TX
pros: Great school to work at
cons: Needs a lot of organization

job_title: Mailroom Clerk in Los Angeles, CA
pros: It a 9-6 job with benefits
cons: Don't pay enough for location

review_title: great workplace, would recommend for any person to have as their first job
job_title: Lifeguard in San Diego, CA
pros: Friendly environment, great working staff, comfortable workplace, not a lot of work consumption.
cons: Lack of information passed down from higher-ups on any events planned for the pool and having to compensate the work to set up the equipment for that particular event.

job_title: Instructional Laboratory Technician
pros: Training; Excellent benefits; Good life-work balance
cons: I cannot think of any

job_title: Landscape Architect in San Diego, CA
pros: Freedom to develop relevant curriculum and good administrative support.
cons: Lots of red tape involved.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Small community with branch campuses in Otay Mesa, San Ysidro, National City and the Aquatic Center on Silverstrand. Good resource for occupational programs.
cons: Small community with long-term employees, many promotions are from within and many employees have been referred by a relative or a friend that is also employed.

job_title: Student Worker in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Amazing and accommodating supervisors who understand needs
cons: Campus is very dark at night. Many mights not functioning

review_title: Overall, a nice place to work
job_title: Project Coordinator in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Leadership can be good depending on the leader, but there's definately room for improvement!  Most of the employees are helpful and enjoyable to work with. There are frequent training opportunities.  'Promotions' are achieved by applying for available positions with higher pay grades.
cons: Politics!  With so many department heads and positions of influence, there are a lot of behind the scenes agreements.  I was frequently required to do 'busy work' that really didn't contribute to effective resolution of some of the projects I was responsible for.

review_title: Great Campus, Great Resources for Faculty and Students
job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Chula Vista, CA
pros: If you enjoy teaching part-time and opportunities to apply for grants this is a good campus that supports faculty. Very organized.  Perks include a complimentary fitness center membership.
cons: As in all adjunct faculty positions, there is more work for part-time available and very few full-time openings.  A salary from 1 class yearly is not enough to sustain a real career.  It is required to also have other work other than teaching for sustainable living.

job_title: Laboratory Technician Assistant (Student Worker) in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Gained valuable hands-on experience preparing petri plates, test tube cultures, operating an autoclave, preparing reagents from stock solutions, and taking inventory of chemical supplies.
cons:
I found Ethidium Bromide (EtBr) and Mercuric Chloride (HgCl) while filling out an inventory. Not entirely unexpected, but both chemicals are hazardous, and neither one was stored in any kind of safety cabinet.

Also, the chemicals were obsolete, as the department was no longer using DNA Electrophoresis Gels that required EtBr, nor pH meters that required refills of HgCl.

review_title: Great experience, poorly managed at times.
job_title: Food Service Worker in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Friendly attitude from many people. Very lenient bosses. Time worked is only during school periods, so school vacations are also work vacations.
cons: The work is not evenly distributed, as some workers do more than others, and management does little to nothing about it. Pay does not reflect amount of work done.

job_title: Tutor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Scheduling is somewhat flexible. Tutors can work pretty much independently and communication is efficient among supervisors, departments and teachers. Work environment is good as well.
cons: Getting paid monthly, one month late -if you start working in January, you will not receive your first pay check until March- unfortunately, that is true for all employees of the college. There are also not many hours per week offered and not a lot of opportunities to grow professionally within the college

job_title: Peer Tutor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: The work environment is generally positive.
cons: There is still much construction/renovation happening on campus; the noise and dust may bother some. There aren't enough tenured faculty - most are adjuncts. It is difficult to acquire even an adjunct position unless you have a referral.

review_title: Being a Student Worker is a Great Learning Experience
job_title: Assistant Lab Technician in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Work before class. Learn new skills. Use specialty gear even when you are not enrolled in that class. Meet new people. Did I mention LEARN NEW SKILLS like how to repair lighting stands/ fixtures, tripods, microphones.
cons: Early start. Average hours. 8am-12pm M-Th. I only worked here for 6 months so it is hard to tell if there is opportunity for advancement.

review_title: A great place to work for a student
job_title: Math Tutor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: It's a community college, so for those in a technical / math oriented field, it should be easy enough to get a job here. The employees are mostly friendly and open minded.
cons: The pay is quite low. You won't want to stay here forever, but it is certainly nice to work at the same place that you go to school.

job_title: Advisor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Great students, beautiful campus, there are a lot of people here who really care about education. I believe it would be easy for anyone to find people of like minds here to build a program.
cons: Hard to make in house transitions.  To go from staff to administrator or faculty can be extremely difficult if you haven't built your network well.

job_title: Administrative Secretary in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Good benefits. Decent pay. Tradition holidays are off. Set hours. Defined workload, tasks, and responsibilities. Sometimes you may find coworkers are are considerate and work together effectively.
cons: To much politics. Poor policies and procedures. Essentially no training to do your job effectively. People back bite and throw you under the bus.

review_title: Not What I Thought working at SWC would be.
job_title: Administrative Assistant II in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Great to be around students and helping them achieve their goals
cons: The poor treatment of the "worker-bees" so that Directors, Deans, & VP's get the accolades. Way to many deadlines and having to work overtime to get things done.

job_title: Instructor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: No Micromanagement from superiors.  You either sink or swim.
cons: The first mistake you make, your classes are canceled and you are jobless.

job_title: Tutor in Chula Vista, CA
pros:
- Flexible Hours
- Decent starting pay
- The job itself is easy
cons:
- Management is unorganized and sometimes inept. For example, our department magically misplaced $200k in funding, so tons of tutor jobs were cut
- Sometimes we're micromanaged. 
- Many recent hires are unqualified.

job_title: School Ambassador in Chula Vista, CA
pros:
- Amazing people who encourage you to do your best and guide you through any issues you may have.
- A sense of independence and no one constantly looking over your shoulder
cons: Short Hours (only up to 10)

job_title: Open Lab Tutor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Talking with people, flexible hours, great atmosphere, great job while you're in college.
cons: Low pay. Every once in a while, getting students who want you to do their work for them.

job_title: Project Technician in Chula Vista, CA
pros: A good place to learn office etiquette and team work.
cons: Project funded positions never feel stable. Union can stymie opportunities for advancement. The National City campus felt a bit unsavory at night.

job_title: Academic Tutor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Very diverse population and rewarding work. Flexible schedule with set hours
cons: Raises are almost nonexistent, and hours are capped at 25

job_title: Corporate Planner in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Incredible coworkers and supervisors, very supportive environment, lots of training offered to tutors
cons: What you work in one month gets paid at the end of the following month

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: The Cisco program was piloted at Southwestern College.
cons: The administrator of the school/division did not do enough to build the Computer Science / Information Systems program.

job_title: Math Tutor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Get to meet new and interesting people.
cons: Get paid once a month and not many hours to work.

job_title: Chemistry Instructor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Students, Professional Development Opportunities, Faculty Resources
cons: Competing visions for equitable and accessible education at the departmental level

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Computer and Internet in the classroom.
cons: Difficult to be hired as a full-time professor once you're an adjunct.

job_title: Proctor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Employees are friendly and respectful.
cons: There are no downsides working here.

job_title: Teacher in San Diego, CA

review_title: SWC hires unproffessional Management to run the college
